Reviews.Title: 512 GB OF RAM!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Marlon Dale Barnes Jr.
Reviews.Content: IT IS LITERALLY IMPOSSIBLE TO BEAT THIS COMPUTER!Especially for 300 bucks!!! You did it again, Mr Jobs. From the grave, no less!Who cares if the hard drive is 60 gb there's so much online storage now and everyone has at least 1 external hard drive.with that much ram you can run, like a billion processes at once like a BAWSE no slowing down here, just gogogo!

Reviews.Title: GREAT FOR THE MONEY!!!
Reviews.Author: Reginald
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop to keep around the house to surf the net and to business on. This laptop is great. If you are looking for a  great laptop I would strongly consider. Shipment was fast and easy.Cons: Its outdated software cant be upgraded

Reviews.Title: I FREAKIN' LOVE MY MACBOOK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: I love it. I love it so much. I don't even know where to start. I'll put it it notes:-the speakers are amazing-you can watch movies on there-it's fast-easy to navigate around-great condition in shipping. it was in a box AND wrapped in bubble wrap. very secure-PacificMacs also had a letter in there for me explaining the company and how long they served apple, and if there were any problems, I call them. Very informative and helpful.-I love how the apple logo lights up on the back-I'll add pics later-The laptop can speak to me like Siri. You can choose between a guy or a girl, and you hold down the ESC key and talk!-I love how you just slide the disc into the computer slot, instead of having to open the thing like other computers and close it back after putting the disk in....and much more!Cons:-You cant install flash player on here, or the updated version of iTunes. But iTunes still works good, and I've watched tons of movies on here.-May be hard to learn how to use at first if you're used to Windows computers/laptops, but search Google to find out how to use it. I did.Tips:-There is no "right click", so Macbook's right click is holding down ctrl, and while holding it down, click on the certain item on the screen that you want to use the "right click" on.-To talk to the computer, you need to first turn on the speech recognition by going to settings. after that's done, to talk to it, hold down the ESC key on the top left corner of your macbook.-The area where you insert discs is located in front of the macbook, where you press the button to open the screen lid. slide the disc into there and it'll take it.-To open the macbook, press the button on the front of it and lift the lid.THANKS, PACIFICMACS!

Reviews.Title: PPC fan.
Reviews.Author: N. D. Jones
Reviews.Content: Sure the GPU might over heat and die (like mind did), or become desoldiered- but logic boards are $50 on eBay. While you are at it, you probably can upgrade from 1.33GHz to 1.5GHz.  I like this computer, it's just old enough to have an Appletalk port and modem, and theoretically communicate with my ancient macs, but new enough to use the Internet and archive old data on an external hard drive.  If you are like me and don't care much about intel macs, and still regularly use os10.5 and older, then give it a try.

Reviews.Title: Great customer experience so far
Reviews.Author: Erik Hand
Reviews.Content: Paid less than $200 and the computer arrived yesterday. It's working well so far. A little slow but that was expected since it's older. I was mainly just looking to not sink a ton of money into a computer that's going to break soon (I've had HP's and Toshibas mainly in the past 9 years and have gone through maybe six of them - some hand me downs - but it's getting a little old, having a new-ish computer break just when you need it!). Great price, and if this lasts a year or more I figure it's worth it. Customer support seems good - the computer came with a note asking for feedback and leaving contact info if you're not satisfied. So far I'm pretty sure I'd buy from this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Its okay for a starter computer...
Reviews.Author: killer4748
Reviews.Content: I have had this PowerBook G4 for about 3 months now. I put and extra 2GB of RAM into it and downgraded th OS X. The screen is warn down so the backlight is TERRIBLE! But the upside is it is great to use around the house! although the PowerPC processor is VERY OUT OF DATE YOU ARE NOT ABLE TO UPGRADE 10.6 and up. think about what your buying some programs are incompatible with the PowerPC processor... oh and the battery life IS TERRIBLE!
